meanings.definition: The state or quality of being a son.
meanings.sent1: His sonhoods brought him joy and pride.
meanings.sent2: The celebration highlighted the importance of sonhoods in families.
meanings.sent3: The sonhoods of the family always made for lively gatherings.
meanings.sent4: In his eyes, the sonhoods of the young boys shone brightly.
meanings.sent5: The essence of sonhoods was evident in the father-son bond.

meanings.definition: The collective qualities or characteristics of sons.
meanings.sent1: The sonhoods of the brothers were evident in their shared love for sports.
meanings.sent2: She admired the sonhoods of the group of friends who always stuck together.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous sonhoods of the boys often led to playful pranks.
meanings.sent4: The sonhoods of the team members made them unstoppable on the field.
meanings.sent5: The strong sonhoods of the siblings helped them overcome any challenge.
